sn46.7:4.1: “Mendicants, the rafters of a bungalow all slant, slope, and incline to the peak.
sn46.7:4.2: In the same way, a mendicant who develops the seven factors of awakening slants, slopes, and inclines to extinguishment.
sn46.7:5.1: And how does a mendicant who develops the seven factors of awakening slant, slope, and incline to extinguishment?
sn46.7:5.2: It’s when a mendicant develops the awakening-factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, samādhi, and
sn46.7:5.3: equanimity, which relies on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripens as letting go.
sn46.7:5.4: That’s how a mendicant who develops the seven factors of awakening slants, slopes, and inclines to extinguishment.”
